Job Title: Specialist II Security

Location: Melbourne, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Management, Other

Description:
Job description:

Job ID: 109362  The Electro Optical Infrared Systems (EOIS) line of business within DRS has locations in Dallas and Austin, TX, Melbourne, FL, and Cypress, CA. EOIS develops, manufactures, and supports infrared and electro-optical solutions for soldiers, ground vehicles and airborne platforms. We offer an exciting and challenging work environment, a competitive salary and benefits package, and a business culture that rewards performance.   Employing the world’s brightest. Supporting the world’s bravest.  Job Summary Job Responsibilities Assist with and executes administration of routine aspects of the Department of Defense (DoD), Department of Energy, (DoE) or other industrial security program to ensure compliance with government and company security policies and proceduresConduct typical security operations to include physical access to buildings, room, couriers, clearances, packages, documentation and debriefingsMonitor security procedures; ensures compliance with all aspects of the program including personnel, physical and administrative security systems and proceduresMay conduct security briefings and maintains security education programsAssist in gathering information for investigations into losses and security violationsEnsure destruction of classified and/or confidential information in accordance with policies and proceduresAssist in revision of procedures manuals and may interface with outside agenciesMay serve as Assistant Facility Security Officer (AFSO) at smaller Defense Security Service-cleared facilities Support, communicate, reinforce and defend the mission, values and culture of the organization  Job Responsibilities Part II Qualifications Associate’s degree or equivalent industrial or physical security trainingMust be able to effectively communicate with peers and other DRS functionsMust have excellent attention to detail and accurate record-keeping skillsMust be able to interpret current government regulations and proceduresMust have the ability to work well with customers, peers, and managementMust have good time management skillsMust excellent experience with the Microsoft Office Suite and SharePoint   Remove if not applicable: U.S. Citizenship required. This position requires an active DOD security clearance or the ability to obtain such clearance within a reasonable time after commencement of employment.Taking care of our people is a top priority at Leonardo DRS. We are proud to offer competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits, including medical, dental, and vision coverage, a company contribution to a health savings account, telemedicine, life and disability insurance, legal insurance, and a 401(k) savings plan. We champion wellness programs that focus on physical, emotional, and financial well-being. We develop our talent by offering programs and activities to support career-growth, professional development, and skill enhancement. And we understand there is more to life than work, and the importance of offering flexible work schedules with our 9/80 program, competitive vacation, health/emergency leave, paid parental leave, and community service hours. 
*Some employees are eligible for limited benefits only Leonardo DRS, Inc. and its subsidiaries and affiliates are equal opportunity employers and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
